column4: Hey! I recently have been through the process of converting to using a single-boot of Ubuntu, instead of dual booting with Linux
The one thing I really miss, is ALT code...
Does anyone know how I can use shortcuts like alt+<number> to make special characters/
as in third level keyboard codes?
I don't know what you mean by that lol
extended ascii characters?
ctrl+alt, u, xxxx
I don't quite understand what you mean
press the ctrl key and the alt key at the same, then the u key, and then your character code.
let me experiment, I just did this last week.
right control+ right shift+ character code
the same way you do with winders, find the needed software, install it, and play with the camera.
o_O well, I'm trying to get my Xbox Live vision camera workin, with Ubuntu, it should work, its just standard USB webcam, nothing special
what is the make and model of the webcam? How you googled for the module(driver) linux needs for it?
rofl its the Xbox Live Vision Camera (made for xbox 360) made by microsoft. Works fine plug & play in windows and mac, I haven't searched google, just wanted to prove a friend wrong
Ok, glad this/I'm amusing, good luck!
lol yeah, I was just gonna see if it would work.
Sounds like cutting edge hardware, support maybe sparse now, with linux.
lol not at all, its not that good, just wanted to see if it would work :)
Roger that, if you can't find it here or on google, you have two options, wait, or write the software yourself.
yeah, I'll google a bit if not whatever, I don't really need it
Yep, good luck, and have fun.
I'll try ;)
